title: What's News: Business & Finance
text:
Epic Games agreed to pay $520 million to resolve FTC allegations that it violated privacy protections for childrenand tricked players into making unintended purchases.

The EU charged Facebook parent Meta with antitrust violations for allegedly distorting competition by tying its online classified-ad service to its social network.

Twitter faced new uncertainty after a majority of respondents voted for Musk to step down as chief executive in an online poll.

Major U.S. stock indexes fell, with the S&P 500, Nasdaq and Dow losing 0.9%, 1.5% and 0.5%, respectively.

The U.S. arm of Binance agreed to acquire the assets of bankrupt crypto lender Voyager Digital.

The Biden administration delayed proposing detailed rules for new tax incentives for electric vehicles, following strong pushback from European and Asian allies.

Honeywell International will pay nearly $203 million to resolve bribery investigations in the U.S. and Brazil, the company said.

What's News: Business & Finance
